Halide  12.0.0
LoopNest.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /** This file defines the LoopNest, which is our
2  * representation of a Halide schedule, and contains methods to
3  * generate candidates for scheduling as well as extract a
4  * featurization that can be used to cost each candidate. */
5 
6 #ifndef LOOP_NEST_H
7 #define LOOP_NEST_H
8 
9 #include "FunctionDAG.h"
10 #include "PerfectHashMap.h"
11 #include <map>
12 #include <set>
13 #include <utility>
14 #include <vector>
15 
16 namespace Halide {
17 namespace Internal {
18 namespace Autoscheduler {
19 
20 template<typename T>
21 using NodeMap = PerfectHashMap<FunctionDAG::Node, T>;
22 
23 template<typename T>
24 using StageMap = PerfectHashMap<FunctionDAG::Node::Stage, T>;
25 
26 bool may_subtile();
27 
28 // Given a multi-dimensional box of dimensionality d, generate a list
29 // of candidate tile sizes for it, logarithmically spacing the sizes
30 // using the given factor. If 'allow_splits' is false, every dimension
31 // must either be one, or the full extent of the box. This function is
32 // used to generate candidate tilings when tiling for
33 // producer-consumer fusion, or tiling for parallelism.
34 std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>> generate_tilings(const vector<int64_t> &s, int d, int factor, bool allow_splits);
35 
36 struct LoopNest {
37  mutable RefCount ref_count;
38 
39  // The extents of this loop. Put another way, the number of tiles,
40  // not the size of each tile.
41  std::vector<int64_t> size;
42 
43  // The nodes inside the loop body
44  std::vector<IntrusivePtr<const LoopNest>> children;
45 
46  // Funcs inlined into this inner loop, and the number of times
47  // each is called. Only valid if children is empty.
48  NodeMap<int64_t> inlined;
49 
50  // Funcs stored inside this loop
51  std::set<const FunctionDAG::Node *> store_at;
52 
53  // The total bounds required of any given Func over all iterations
54  // of this loop. In the paper, this is represented using the
55  // little boxes to the left of the loop nest tree figures.
56  mutable NodeMap<Bound> bounds;
57 
58  // The Func this loop nest belongs to
59  const FunctionDAG::Node *node = nullptr;
60 
61  // The stage of the Func
62  const FunctionDAG::Node::Stage *stage = nullptr;
63 
64  // Is this the innermost loop of this func (the SIMD loop)?
65  bool innermost = false;
66 
67  // Are we permitted to tile this loop?
68  bool tileable = false;
69 
70  // Is this the parallel outer loop?
71  bool parallel = false;
72 
73  // What dimension is this Func vectorized over, in terms of the pure args of the Func?
74  int vector_dim = -1;
75 
76  // Which loop corresponds to the innermost storage dimension and will be vectorized. -1 means none of them.
77  int vectorized_loop_index = -1;
78 
79  void copy_from(const LoopNest &n);
80 
81  static void hash_combine(uint64_t &h, uint64_t next) {
82  // From boost
83  h ^= (next + 0x9e3779b9 + (h << 6) + (h >> 2));
84  }
85 
86  // Hash the loop structure and sizes up to a fixed depth. This is
87  // used as the hash function for the coarse-to-fine beam search in
88  // the paper.
89  void structural_hash(uint64_t &h, int depth) const;
90 
91  // How many funcs are scheduled inside this loop level. Used in
92  // the structural hash.
93  size_t funcs_realized_or_inlined() const {
94  size_t count = inlined.size() + store_at.size();
95  for (const auto &c : children) {
96  count += c->funcs_realized_or_inlined();
97  }
98  return count;
99  }
100 
101  // All of a stage's interesting locations in the loop nest. Used to help compute the featurization of a stage.
102  struct Sites {
103  const LoopNest *compute = nullptr; // Its containing compute_at site
104  const LoopNest *store = nullptr; // Its containing store_at site
105  const LoopNest *produce = nullptr; // Its own outermost node
106  const LoopNest *innermost = nullptr; // Its innermost node - usually a SIMD loop
107  const LoopNest *task = nullptr; // The parallel for loop it belongs to
108  bool inlined = false; // Is the Func inlined?
109  };
110 
111  // Compute all the sites of interest for each pipeline stage
112  void get_sites(StageMap<Sites> &sites,
113  const LoopNest *task = nullptr,
114  const LoopNest *parent = nullptr) const;
115 
116  // A helper for the working_set_at_task feature. Most features are
117  // computed in the recursive pass 'compute_features' below, but
118  // this one must be done in a second separate recursive pass.
119  void set_working_set_at_task_feature(int64_t working_set,
120  StageMap<ScheduleFeatures> *features) const {
121  for (const auto &c : children) {
122  c->set_working_set_at_task_feature(working_set, features);
123  features->get(c->stage).working_set_at_task = working_set;
124  }
125  }
126 
127  // Do a recursive walk over the loop nest computing features to feed the cost model.
128  void compute_features(const FunctionDAG &dag,
129  const MachineParams &params,
130  const StageMap<Sites> &sites,
131  int64_t instances,
132  int64_t parallelism,
133  const LoopNest *parent,
134  const LoopNest *grandparent,
135  const LoopNest &root,
136  int64_t *working_set,
137  StageMap<ScheduleFeatures> *features) const;
138 
139  bool is_root() const {
140  // The root is the sole node without a Func associated with
141  // it.
142  return node == nullptr;
143  }
144 
145  // Set the region required of a Func at this site.
146  const Bound &set_bounds(const FunctionDAG::Node *f, BoundContents *b) const {
147  return bounds.emplace(f, b);
148  }
149 
150  // Get the region required of a Func at this site, from which we
151  // know what region would be computed if it were scheduled here,
152  // and what its loop nest would be.
153  const Bound &get_bounds(const FunctionDAG::Node *f) const;
154 
155  // Recursively print a loop nest representation to stderr
156  void dump(string prefix, const LoopNest *parent) const;
157 
158  // Does this loop nest access the given Func
159  bool calls(const FunctionDAG::Node *f) const;
160 
161  // What is the maximum number of inlined calls to a Func that
162  // occur within this loop. Used to prune states that would
163  // generate too much code.
164  int64_t max_inlined_calls() const;
165 
166  // Does this loop nest access an input buffer? Used to select
167  // trail strategies when splitting loops. We don't want to read
168  // out of bounds on inputs, even if we don't intend to use the
169  // values read. It could create annoying assertion failures for
170  // the user. It's OK to read out of range of the values computed
171  // on internal Funcs though. Allocation bounds inference just pads
172  // out the bounds so that it won't fault.
173  bool accesses_input_buffer() const;
174 
175  // Does this loop nest contain a computation of the given Func.
176  bool computes(const FunctionDAG::Node *f) const;
177 
178  // Above here most methods query the loop nest. Below we have
179  // methods that mutate the loop nest.
180 
181  // Inline a Func into all consumers within this loop.
182  void inline_func(const FunctionDAG::Node *f);
183 
184  // Compute a Func at this site.
185  void compute_here(const FunctionDAG::Node *f, bool tileable, int v);
186 
187  // Parallelize this loop according to the given tiling.
188  IntrusivePtr<const LoopNest> parallelize_in_tiles(const MachineParams &params,
189  const vector<int64_t> &tiling,
190  const LoopNest *parent) const;
191 
192  // Return all possible ways to compute f in tiles somewhere within
193  // this loop nest.
194  std::vector<IntrusivePtr<const LoopNest>> compute_in_tiles(const FunctionDAG::Node *f,
195  const LoopNest *parent,
196  const MachineParams &params,
197  int v,
198  bool in_realization) const;
199 
200  // Below here we have methods that apply a schedule to a Halide pipeline.
201 
202  // A model of the state of the loop nest of a Func while applying
203  // Halide's scheduling directives.
204 
205  // Note that StageScheduleState is movable-but-not-copyable thanks
206  // to its ostringstream member.
207  struct StageScheduleState {
208  // How much parallelism do we need to exploit with this Func?
209  double num_cores = 0;
210 
211  // Which storage dimension is vectorized? We need to reorder it innermost
212  int vector_dim = -1;
213  int vectorized_loop_index = -1;
214 
215  // The various Vars and RVars used for scheduling a Func.
216  struct FuncVar {
217  // The top-level var or rvar this was split off from
218  VarOrRVar orig;
219 
220  // This var.
221  VarOrRVar var;
222 
223  // Source code to access this Var/RVar. Used for printing
224  // valid Halide source for this schedule.
225  string accessor;
226 
227  // Our estimate of the extent of this var. This is exact
228  // when constant_extent flag is true.
229  int64_t extent = 0;
230 
231  // Which index in the symbolic loop nest does this var
232  // belong to.
233  size_t index = 0;
234 
235  // Some flags.
236  bool innermost_pure_dim = false,
237  outermost = false,
238  parallel = false,
239  exists = false,
240  pure = false,
241  constant_extent = false;
242  FuncVar()
243  : orig(Var()), var(Var()) {
244  }
245  };
246 
247  // In order from innermost to outermost. Each group of d is one tiling level.
248  std::vector<FuncVar> vars;
249 
250  std::ostringstream schedule_source;
251  };
252 
253  // Apply the schedule represented by this loop nest to a Halide pipeline.
254  void apply(LoopLevel here,
255  StageMap<std::unique_ptr<StageScheduleState>> &state_map,
256  double num_cores,
257  int depth,
258  const LoopNest *parent,
259  const LoopNest *compute_site) const;
260 };
261 
262 // Find the deepest common ancestor of `a` and `b`.
263 // `parents` is a map from loop nest to (parent, depth) tuples.
264 // Assumes that `a` and `b` are found in `parents`, otherwise errors.
265 const LoopNest *deepest_common_ancestor(const std::map<const LoopNest *, std::pair<const LoopNest *, int>> &parents,
266  const LoopNest *a, const LoopNest *b);
267 
268 // Compute the parent and depth of every loop nest node.
269 // Stores in `parents` the children of `here` (keys) to tuples of (here, depth).
270 // Recurses on all children of `here`.
271 void compute_loop_nest_parents(std::map<const LoopNest *, std::pair<const LoopNest *, int>> &parents,
272  const LoopNest *here, int depth);
273 
274 } // namespace Autoscheduler
275 } // namespace Internal
276 } // namespace Halide
